poem:
Title: "The Merge of Titans"

High street's wheel churns
in the oil of capitalism.
Virgin – a lamb in wolf's deal,
Sacrificed, as giants dance
on the altar of acquisition.
Nationwide reaps, sowing
£3bn seeds of dominion,
Harvesting the future's uncertainty.
In the quiet of numbers,
Who hears the hollow echoes,
In the vaults of saving souls?
Whispers of labour, mortgages —
Lost in the language of assets.
